text:
ate and other B vitamins10 play an important role in the regulation of energy metabolism, help to 
alleviate insulin resistance and are essential for human growth, including nerve and brain development. Folate 
deficiency is associated with anaemia and neural tube defects (NTDs), intrauterine growth restriction and other 
fetal malformations, preterm delivery and low birth weight. NTDs are among the most common congenital 
anomalies contributing to infant mortality and serious disability [17, 12
